htmltoscene.title: HTML To Scene
htmltoscene.pathPlaceholder: Relative File Path from "Data" or a URL

enable.name: Enable
enable.desc: Enables HTML To Scene on this scene.

fileLoc.name: Select HTML file
fileLoc.hint: You can select any HTML file stored on your FoundryVTT's data folder by using a relative path.
fileLoc.tip: Do it on a empty canvas to increase performance. You can also put some websites that allow iframes.

minUI.name: Minimal User Interface
minUI.desc: Hides unnecessary FoundryVTT's UI elements while a HTML file is being displayed.

keepTop.name: Keep Scene Changer
keepTop.desc: Maintains the Scene Changer at the top of the screen in any case.

keepPlayerList.name: Keep Player List
keepPlayerList.desc: Maintains the player list in its original position.

keepBottomControls.name: Keep Bottom Controls

values.both: Allow the hotbar and the cameras
values.macroplusfps: Allow the hotbar and the FPS meter
values.cameraplusfps: Allow the cameras and the FPS meter
values.bothplusfps: Allow the hotbar, the cameras and the FPS meter

keepBottomControls.desc: Allows you to select how do you want the bottom controls be displayed.

spaceRight.name: Respect Sidebar's Space
spaceRight.desc: Adds an empty space under the sidebar.
spaceRight.tip: You can change the color of the canvas' background color to affect the color behind the controls.

rightDisabled.name: Hide Sidebar
rightDisabled.desc: Hides the sidebar from the UI, enabling back the scene changer on the top. (Ideal if your group communicates via voice chat or doesn't need to throw dice).
rightDisabled.tip: You might want to have other scene visible to gain back normal FoundryVTT's controls. (If not, you can always disable this module for the current scene).

hidePaused.name: Hide 'Game Paused'
hidePaused.desc: Hides 'Game Paused' over the HTML file if the game is paused.

hideBoard.name: Hide FoundryVTT's Board
hideBoard.desc: Hides the board for a noticeable performace boost. (You WILL NOT render the canvas).
hideBoard.tip: Other modules that may depend on the board might malfunction or do nothing, check your browser's console.

passData.name: Enable Helpers For Two-Way Communication
passData.desc: Puts in use inactive variables to help to make two way communication between the iframe and FoundryVTT easier. See the wiki on GitHub for a better explanation.
passData.tip: To fully make use of this you will need to have coding and macro knowledge.

dataUpdateRate.name: FoundryVTTAccess Update Rate
dataUpdateRate.desc: Changes the speed that the variable FoundryVTTAccess updates with new information. Use updateRate to sync it with your iframe.
dataUpdateRate.tip: This could affect performace. Depends on the use.

iFrameRefreshRate.name: IFrame Refreshing

values.oneminute: It will be forcefully updated once every minute
values.thirtyseconds: It will be forcefully updated once every thirty seconds
values.fifteenseconds: It will be forcefully updated once every fifteen seconds
values.tenseconds: It will be forcefully updated once every ten seconds
values.fiveseconds: It will be forcefully updated once every five seconds

iFrameRefreshRate.desc: Changes the speed that the IFrame is forcefully refreshed.
iFrameRefreshRate.tip: This feature is intended to provide a way to reload the Iframe without having to reload FoundryVTT. You shouldn't use this as a way to refresh information from it, as it will attempt the reload to all players, having to serve everything again.

htmltoscene.rememberjsexecution: Please, remember to input only files that you fully trust. You might be allowing unwanted javascript execution in your system. And that is bad.
